result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel S. Wiedenhoeft

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joel S. Wiedenhoeft in court.  Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz in court for Joel S. Wiedenhoeft.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM.  State sent reports to Atty Schwarz who needs to review them yet. Adjmt granted.  FPT scheduled. Bond continued.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant, Joel S. Wiedenhoeft, appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over.   Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.
